event_text: m_c can't keep this secret anymore. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/request/requests} a Clan meeting, where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/reveal/reveals} the terrible secret {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'ve/'s} kept; {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} killed mur_c.
r_c is stunned when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/discover/discovers} m_c carelessly bragging about killing mur_c to a wandering loner.
m_c is truthful when r_c questions {PRONOUN/m_c/object} about mur_c's strange death. m_c claims that mur_c deserved to die after what {PRONOUN/mur_c/subject} did to m_c.
m_c boldly confesses to the entire Clan that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} killed mur_c. m_c claims that mur_c deserved to pay for what {PRONOUN/mur_c/subject} did.
m_c's cold eyes don't blink when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} accused of murdering mur_c, and only simply states that the Clan is better off without mur_c anyways.
m_c doesn't change expressions in the slightest when r_c accuses {PRONOUN/m_c/object} of murdering mur_c. Who cares?
r_c avoids m_c at all costs after accidentally witnessing mur_c's murder. r_c knows {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can't keep it a secret but is terrified of what m_c might do.

r_c gathers all the courage {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} and quietly tells m_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/know/knows} what {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} did to mur_c. m_c glares menacingly and threatens r_c with the same fate if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} keep {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth shut.
m_c laughs menacingly as r_c accuses {PRONOUN/m_c/object} of murdering mur_c. So what if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} did? What is r_c going to do about it?
m_c can't keep this secret anymore. When {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/find/finds} {PRONOUN/m_c/self} alone with r_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/tell/tells} the story of mur_c's death.

r_c overheard m_c muttering in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} sleep, claws slashing at the air. {PRONOUN/m_c/poss/CAP} muttering confirms what r_c always suspected -  m_c was the one responsible for mur_c's death.

r_c wasn't even suspecting {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. But as soon as r_c mentions mur_c's death, m_c breaks down, telling how {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} didn't intend to do it, that it was all just an accident. Between wails, m_c desperately begs for r_c to understand {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} never wanted mur_c to die.

c_n is surprised when m_c gathers everyone to say something important. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/have/has} decided it's time to make something clear: {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} killed mur_c, but not for the reasons they might think. m_c knew mur_c was planning to do something that would've damaged c_n greatly, and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} needed to act quickly before it was too late.

r_c quietly takes m_c aside and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/know/knows} what {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} did to mur_c. Before m_c has time to defend {PRONOUN/m_c/self}, r_c eerily smiles and assures {PRONOUN/m_c/object} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} won't tell anyone, that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/agree/agrees} with what m_c did. m_c squints {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eyes, not sure if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} should trust r_c's words.

One day, when m_c and r_c are alone together, r_c gathers the courage to finally tell m_c what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} been holding off for so long: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/know/knows} m_c was the one who killed mur_c, and has been waiting for {PRONOUN/m_c/object} to do the right thing and confess, but if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/don't/doesn't} do it, then r_c will have to be the one to tell the Clan. m_c is shocked, but also kind of admires r_c's guts to tell {PRONOUN/m_c/object} that when they're all alone together.

r_c sighs. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} {PRONOUN/r_c/self} unintentionally walking into one of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates' dreams again. It could have been just another boring or nonsensical dream, but r_c is horrified to discover this dream is m_c's recollection of murdering mur_c. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/wake/wakes} up in shock, wondering what to do with this new knowledge.
m_c went for a long walk this morning, deep in thought.
m_c disappears for a few days, then returns to camp with a acc_singular around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} neck.

m_c wasn't looking where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/were/was} going and tripped over a small trunk, but came out of it with only {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pride bruised.
m_c misstepped and slipped from a rock, but landed on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} feet nimbly, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clanmates commenting on the show of dexterity.

The world around {PRONOUN/m_c/object} feels smaller lately; m_c looks out at the horizon and yearns for something unnameable.
m_c's dreams are filled with flashing teeth and blood-scent. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wake/wakes} up screaming.
m_c thought {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw a familiar wispy form lingering at the edge of camp, but the ghost disappeared before {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} could be sure.

m_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to keep them.

The war with o_c_n is beginning to disrupt the daily lives of c_n, forcing them to adapt to new routines and living situations in order to better defend themselves.

m_c noticed the leftovers on fresh-kill pile. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} saw a acc_singular and out of curiosity put it on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur. Then {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} looked at the surface of the puddle and decided that it suited {PRONOUN/m_c/object} perfectly.
m_c notices an insect with beautiful wings. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} catches it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} ears with it.

m_c was on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} morning patrol. As {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} about to return to camp, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} noticed something in the bushes. It was a large acc_singular! m_c liked it so much that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} wanted to decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} den with it. r_c helped {PRONOUN/m_c/object} carry it to camp.
m_c was gone for a few days. When {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} finally returned m_c had a very specific smell and a strange object. m_c never explained where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} been.

m_c returned to camp very late. {PRONOUN/m_c/poss/CAP} clanmates smelled the awful scent and moved away from {PRONOUN/m_c/object} . On top of that, m_c's fur was all dirty and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/were/was} carrying something. All m_c said was that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} fallen into some black hole.
The tension between c_n and o_c_n is palpable, with even the smallest actions potentially leading to violence.
m_c and r_c are so cuddled up and cozy in their nest they almost miss the dawn patrol.
